net.jnellis.binpack

Class BinPacker<P extends Comparable<P>,C extends Comparable<C>,B extends Bin<P,C>>

  • Object
    • net.jnellis.binpack.BinPacker<P,C,B>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LinearBinPacker

    public abstract class BinPacker<P extends Comparable<P>,C extends Comparable<C>,B extends Bin<P,C>>
extends Object
    BinPacker is a processor of packing operations. This is an abstract base class for defining specific bin packers. 
    
 List<Double> pieces = Arrays.asList(3d, 4d, 8d, 5d, 7d);
 List<LinearBin> bins = new ArrayList<>();
 // bins are only 6.0 long
 List<Double> capacities = Arrays.asList(6d);
 LinearBinPacker binPacker = new SpliceableBinPacker();
 bins = binPacker.setPreOrderPolicy(new Descending<>())
                 .setPackingPolicy(new BestFit<>())
                 .setAvailableCapacitiesPreOrderPolicy(new Descending<>())
                 .packAll(pieces, bins, capacities);

 // bins are packed as such with remainders of larger bins split up.
 // [6.0], [6.0], [5.0, 1.0], [4.0, 2.0], [3.0]
    See Also:
    SpliceableBinPacker

      • getPackingPolicy

        public PackingPolicy<P,C,B> getPackingPolicy()
        Returns the PackingPolicy for choosing a bin before a pack.
        Returns:
        the current PackingPolicy

      • setPackingPolicy

        public BinPacker<P,C,B> setPackingPolicy(PackingPolicy<P,C,B> policy)
        Sets the packing algorithm to be used to fit pieces into bins. The default PackingPolicy is BestFit
        Parameters:
        policy - The algorithm to pack one piece into a set of bins.
        Returns:
        Returns this BinPacker for use in chainable operations.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if packingPolicy is null.

      • getExistingBinPreOrderPolicy

        public PreOrderPolicy<B> getExistingBinPreOrderPolicy()
        Returns the PreOrderPolicy that will be applied to existingBins before the pack.
        Returns:
        the current PreOrderPolicy for existing bins.

      • setExistingBinPreOrderPolicy

        public BinPacker<P,C,B> setExistingBinPreOrderPolicy(PreOrderPolicy<B> preOrderPolicy)
        Sets the ordering to be imposed upon existing Bins. The method packAll(java.util.List<P>, java.util.List<B>, java.util.List<C>) will sort bins by each bin's compareTo method, preferably upon the bin's remaining capacity. The default is Descending which represents an ordering of emptiest bins first.
        Parameters:
        preOrderPolicy - The pre-ordering algorithm
        Returns:
        Returns this BinPacker for use in chainable operations.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if preOrderPolicy is null.

      • getAvailableCapacitiesPreOrderPolicy

        public PreOrderPolicy<C> getAvailableCapacitiesPreOrderPolicy()
        Returns the PreOrderPolicy that will be applied to available capacities before the pack.
        Returns:
        the PreOrderPolicy for available bin capacities.

      • setAvailableCapacitiesPreOrderPolicy

        public BinPacker<P,C,B> setAvailableCapacitiesPreOrderPolicy(PreOrderPolicy<C> preOrderPolicy)
        Sets the ordering to be imposed upon available capacities of new Bins. The method packAll(java.util.List<P>, java.util.List<B>, java.util.List<C>) will sort bin capacities in the order they will be tried when trying to fit a piece in a new bin. The default is Ascending.
        Parameters:
        preOrderPolicy - The pre-ordering algorithm
        Returns:
        Returns this BinPacker for use in chainable operations.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if perOrderPolicy is null.

      • getPreOrderPolicy

        public PreOrderPolicy<P> getPreOrderPolicy()
        Returns the PreOrderPolicy for pieces before a pack.
        Returns:
        the current PreOrderPolicy

      • setPreOrderPolicy

        public BinPacker<P,C,B> setPreOrderPolicy(PreOrderPolicy<P> policy)
        Sets the ordering to be imposed on pieces. The method packAll(java.util.List<P>, java.util.List<B>, java.util.List<C>) will sort pieces by this ordering before packing. The default is Descending.
        Parameters:
        policy - The pre-ordering algorithm
        Returns:
        Returns this BinPacker for use in chainable operations.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if preOrderPolicy is null.

      • packAll

        public List<B> packAll(List<P> pieces,
                       List<B> existingBins,
                       List<C> availableCapacities)
        Attempts to store pieces into bins, starting with existingBins. When a new bin is required, one is copied from the availableCapacities set according to the existingBinPreOrderPolicy.
        Parameters:
        pieces - List of pieces to be packed.
        existingBins - The initial set of bins will be made with these capacities.
        availableCapacities - An array of bin capacities we can make when we need another bin.
        Returns:
        Returns the modified list of existingBins

      • pack

        public List<B> pack(P piece,
                    List<B> existingBins,
                    List<C> availableCapacities)
        Attempts to place one piece into bins of existingBins sizes first then uses availableCapacities bin sizes when it needs to fill a new bin.
        Parameters:
        piece - The pieces that need to be packed.
        existingBins - Existing bins that pieces will be packed into first.
        availableCapacities - Available bin sizes that we can create.
        Returns:
        Returns the new existingBins.

      • addNewBin

        protected abstract B addNewBin(P piece,
                               List<B> existingBins,
                               List<C> availableCapacities)
        Add a new bin to the list of existing bins. New bin should be able to take on available capacities. Implementations must not add piece to new bin, the piece parameter is simply for determining capacity constraints. Implementations should throw AssertionError if piece won't fit in a new bin of any capacity specified.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece that wants to be added.
        existingBins - New bins will be added to this list.
        availableCapacities - Capacities for new bins.
        Returns:
        the newly created bin.
